page.title: 01An introduction to the area
page.content: On the south side of Brampton, housing gives place abrubtly to a fertile stretch of rolling, sandy countryside, largely pasture and meadow,{with dairy {farming and sheep-rearing the main {occupation.} Housing is confined to a council estate, two hamlets:{Milton}and{Farlam and a few scattered farms. Roads from{Brampton}cross the area to{ {Carlisle, Alston and Castle Carrock.}A network of country lanes leads to surrounding villages.{The Carlisle- {Newcastle Railway line}cuts across this stretch of land. The{River Gelt}flows rapidly along its rocky bed though ancient mixed woodland where from Roman times until recently, stone was quarried. The most remarkable feature is Talkin Tarn, a natural lake within a Country Park, a beautiful area and recreation area.
